Class ArrivalProcess

java.lang.Object
MVC.simu.framework.ArrivalProcess
public class ArrivalProcess extends Object
Represents the arrival process in a discrete-event simulation.

The ArrivalProcess is responsible for generating new arrival events based on a given probability distribution (for example, exponential or normal). Each generated event is added to the global EventList to be processed later by the simulation engine.

Responsibilities:

  • Samples inter-arrival times from a ContinuousGenerator
  • Schedules new Events of a specific EventType
  • Uses the shared Clock to determine the current simulation time

Typically used by the simulation model MyEngine to create incoming customers, applications, or entities that enter the system.

  • Constructor Details

    • ArrivalProcess

      public ArrivalProcess(ContinuousGenerator g, EventList tl, EventType type)
      Constructs a new ArrivalProcess with the given generator, event list, and event type.
      Parameters:
      g - the continuous random generator providing inter-arrival times
      tl - the global event list to which new events are added
      type - the event type associated with each generated arrival

  • Method Details

    • generateNext

      public void generateNext()
      Generates the next arrival event and schedules it in the event list.

      The new event's time is calculated as the current simulation time plus a random sample from the inter-arrival time distribution.
